nodes.text: A thousand-page book was a compilation of poems, journal entries, and historical records focusing on the planet Nazzri's last reigning Emperor-King, Prrit Qabaq, and the events surrounding the downfall of the planet's monarchy. The tome had survived the purge of all records concerning Qabaq ordered by his daughter Ikree, the first queen-praefect of the oligarchical theocracy that succeeded Qabaq's government, and came to rest in Nazzri's Hall of Edification.

After Crown Prince Qrrrl Toq of Nazzri read through the volume at least a millennium after the establishment of the theocratical government, he decided that instead of attempting to match the achievements of prior monarch-praefects, he needed to discover and follow his own way, and subsequently the Nazzar prince left Nazzri on a self-imposed exile known as boqeri.
